articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least 30 Palestinians were killed in Israeli military strikes across the Gaza Strip on Thursday, mostly in the north where one attack hit a hospital, torching medical supplies and disrupting operations, the enclave's health officials said.
articles.title: At least 30 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes, hospital hit, says Gaza ministry

articles.author: Jack Kim, Kaori Kaneko
articles.description: North Korea conducted what appeared to be its longest ever intercontinental ballistic missile test on Thursday as South Korea warned Pyongyang could seek missile technology from Russia in exchange for deploying troops to help with the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea conducts longest ICBM test amid storm over troop deployment to Russia

articles.author: Yuliia Dysa, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy blasted what he called his allies' "zero" response to Russia's deployment of North Korean troops for the war in Ukraine, saying on Thursday a weak reaction would encourage Russia's Vladimir Putin to beef up the contingent.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy blasts allies for 'zero' response to N.Korean deployment

articles.author: David Latona
articles.description: Spain issued another storm warning on Thursday for part of the Valenica region devastated by floods that have killed at least 95 people, as rescuers scoured flooded fields and stranded cars for those still missing.
articles.title: Spanish rescue teams hunt for missing after deadly floods

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Nervously watching Israel's destructive campaigns in Gaza and Lebanon, Iraq is working to avoid being drawn into the growing regional conflict as Iran-backed armed groups launch attacks on Israel from Iraqi soil, sources familiar with the matter say.
articles.title: Iraq tries to avoid regional fight as militias fire at Israel

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: More than 400 alleged victims have so far contacted the legal team working on a case against the late Egyptian billionaire Mohamed Al Fayed, who has been accused of sexual abuse and rape, lawyer Dean Armstrong said on Thursday.
articles.title: Over 400 alleged victims of ex-Harrods boss Al Fayed come forward

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump sued CBS on Thursday over an interview of his Democratic rival Kamala Harris aired in early October that the lawsuit alleged was "doctored" and misleading, according to a court filing.
articles.title: Trump sues CBS over Kamala Harris interview

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States said on Thursday it was concerned by Vietnam's conviction and "harsh" sentencing of blogger Duong Van Thai, and deeply troubled by reports he was abducted by Vietnamese authorities in Thailand.
articles.title: US calls Vietnam's blogger sentence harsh, deeply troubled by abduction reports

articles.author: Felix Light, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Three Georgian opposition parties who allege last weekend's election was rigged called for streets protests next Monday as an exit pollster said the official result, which gave victory to the ruling Georgian Dream party, was "statistically impossible".
articles.title: Georgian opposition calls for more protests as exit pollster says official result 'impossible'

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States has received information that indicates that "right now" there are 8,000 North Korean troops in Russia's Kursk region, deputy U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Robert Wood told the Security Council on Thursday.
articles.title: US says 8,000 North Korean troops in Russia's Kursk
